name: Al-Arqam Islamic School
mission: TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE MUSLIM CHILDREN LIVING WITHIN THE GREATER SACRAMENTO AREA.
theoryOfChange: Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory has published "Schoolwide Learning Outcomes (SLOs)" or "Student Learning Goals (SLGs)" that serve as a strategic framework. These goals are focused on establishing strong, cohesive, and engaging school programs designed to impact students academically, spiritually, socially, and physically. The school's updated SLOs are conveyed through the acrostic TORCH. The Student Learning Goals include five key areas: to live Islam, become lifelong learners, be effective communicators, be citizens of the world, and honor themselves physically and spiritually.
zakatClaimEvidence: The donation page for Al-Arqam Islamic School (Sacramento, CA, USA) provides options for checks, PayPal, and Zelle donations but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or dedicated zakat funds.

all_citations.claim: Al-Arqam Islamic School is identified by EIN 94-3311132 and provides educational services.
The organization reported total revenue of $4,155,519, a program expense ratio of 98.1%, working capital of 9.1 months, and fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The school offers an International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program and college preparatory academics.
The organization is officially known as Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory.
The school maintains specific student conduct and parent policies to meet the educational needs of Muslim children in Sacramento.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is rated as medium-low because while the school addresses the urgent cause of global education, there is limited evidence of broad Muslim donor fit or third-party verification of its specific religious programming [1][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The school demonstrates moderate impact through capacity building, utilizing 98.1% of its $4,155,519 revenue for program expenses [1][2]. While it provides high-level academic programs like the IB Diploma, the lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data results in a balanced impact score [3][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Al-Arqam Islamic School provides a rigorous college preparatory education and International Baccalaureate programming for Muslim youth in the Greater Sacramento area.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 98.1% ensures most funds directly support student education
Offers specialized International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma and college preparatory tracks
Strong financial stability with 9.1 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School is a dedicated educational institution focused on meeting the academic needs of Muslim children through a curriculum that includes the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program [1][3]. The organization operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, reporting total revenue of $4,155,519 and maintaining a strong focus on direct program delivery [2].

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-term investment in Islamic educational infrastructure and prioritize schools with high academic standards like the IB program.

Prefer organizations with extremely low overhead and zero fundraising costs

The school is a localized institution serving the Sacramento community
Financial reporting is currently limited to basic tax filings
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill Zakat obligations or those who require rigorous third-party impact data.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The school has a <cite id="18">clear theory of change</cite> and high-level academic tracks, but lacks <cite id="17">external impact evaluations</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The school creates impact by providing a dual-curriculum environment that prepares students for higher education while reinforcing Islamic identity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the educational model effectively leads to college success and long-term student wellbeing.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a growing institution with a <cite id="13">3.1% CAGR</cite>, additional funding is needed to expand facilities and scholarship programs.

strengths.detail: The school directs <cite id="7">100.0% of its expenses toward program services</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="10">industry standard of 75%</cite>.
Al-Arqam is authorized to offer the <cite id="3">International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program</cite>, a globally recognized standard for college readiness.
The organization maintains <cite id="9">9.1 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring operational continuity and resilience against revenue fluctuations.

strengths_deep_dive: Al-Arqam Islamic School demonstrates a high level of fiscal responsibility, evidenced by a <cite id="11">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, meaning virtually all donations directly support student services. This efficiency is paired with a <cite id="12">100% independent board of directors</cite>, which provides critical oversight and governance. The school's growth is steady, reflected in a <cite id="13">3-year revenue CAGR of 3.1%</cite>, while its <cite id="14">net assets grew to $2,508,212</cite> by the end of 2023. This financial health supports a comprehensive educational model that includes a <cite id="15">Student Honor Code of Conduct</cite> and rigorous admissions standards to maintain academic excellence.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1998</cite>, Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory serves the Greater Sacramento area by providing a <cite id="2">rigorous college preparatory education</cite> rooted in Islamic values. The institution is distinguished by its status as an <cite id="3">International Baccalaureate (IB) World School</cite>, offering the prestigious IB Diploma Program alongside <cite id="4">Advanced Placement (AP) and Honors courses</cite>. In the 2023 fiscal year, the school reported <cite id="5">total revenue of $4,155,519</cite>, with a significant portion of income derived from <cite id="6">program service revenue totaling $3,925,159</cite>. The organization demonstrates exceptional financial leanliness, maintaining a <cite id="7">program expense ratio of 98.1%</cite>, which indicates that all functional expenses are directed toward its educational mission. Beyond academics, the school integrates <cite id="8">Tarbiyyah, including Islamic Studies and Qur’an</cite>, into its core curriculum to foster a strong religious identity among Muslim youth. Financial stability is a key hallmark of the organization, which holds <cite id="9">9.1 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, providing a robust cushion for long-term institutional sustainability.
